member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1
member.summary: The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ValueExpression
member.summary: Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Max
member.summary: Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Min
member.summary: Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.CalendarMode
member.summary: Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, the following list of states will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.KeyConfigs
member.summary:
Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ServerTimezoneOffset
member.summary:
By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ShowTodayButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.WeekNumber
member.summary: Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.WeekRule
member.summary: Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected date of the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ValueChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DatePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.AllowEdit
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via typing. When set as false, the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via picker only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DateRangePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary:
Enable or disable the persisting DateRangePicker's state between the page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted.
StartDate
EndDate
Value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateRangePicker in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in DateRangePicker.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateRangePicker considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.KeyConfigs
member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DateRangePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date that can be selected in the calendar-popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.MaxDays
member.summary: Specifies the maximum span of days that can be allowed in a date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the calendar-popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.MinDays
member.summary: Specifies the minimum span of days that can be allowed in date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DateRangePicker. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Presets
member.summary: Set the predefined ranges which let the user pick required range easily in a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Separator
member.summary: Sets or gets the string that used between the start and end date string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon in DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the start and end date of the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.WeekNumber
member.summary: Determines whether the week number of the Calendar is to be displayed or not. The week number is displayed in every week row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the DateRangePicker component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel`1.ZIndex
member.summary: specifies the z-index value of the DateRangePicker popup element.

member.summary: Triggers when the popup is opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.RenderDayCell
member.summary: Triggers when each day cell of the Calendar is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.AllowEdit
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateTimePicker allows user to change the value via typing. When set as false, the DateTimePicker allows user to change the value via picker only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.CalendarMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's Type like gregorian or islamic.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DateTimePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DateTimePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is Short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting DateTimePicker's state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateTimePicker in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateTimePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateTimePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateTimePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateTimePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateTimePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateTimePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in DateTimePicker.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateTimePicker considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.KeyConfigs
member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DateTimePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the DateTimePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date that can be selected in the DateTimePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the DateTimePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DateTimePicker. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateTimePicker allows the user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.ScrollTo
member.summary: Specifies the scroll bar position, if there is no value is selected in the timepicker popup list or the given value is not present in the timepicker popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.ServerTimezoneOffset
member.summary: By default, the date value will be processed based on system time zone. If you want to process the initial date value using server time zone then specify the time zone value to `ServerTimezoneOffset` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon in textbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.ShowTodayButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the today button is to be displayed or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.Step
member.summary: Specifies the time interval between the two adjacent time values in the time popup list .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.TimeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the time value that to be displayed in time popup list.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected date of the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.WeekNumber
member.summary: Determines whether the week number of the year is to be displayed in the calendar or not.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the DateTimePicker component.

member.summary: Specifies the z-index value of the DateTimePicker popup element.

member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DatePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DatePickerModel.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors
member.summary:
Specifies the data adaptors
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.BaseComponent
member.summary: A Base Component for all the Syncfusion Blazor UI components.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
member.summary: The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications. It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Url
member.summary: Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance
member.summary: Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
member.remarks: DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance. Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach. To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DataAdaptor
member.summary: Holds adaptor instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DotNetObjectRef
member.summary: Holds dotnet instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.InsertUrl
member.summary: Specifies the insert URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl. If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the remove URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl. If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.UpdateUrl
member.summary: Specifies the update URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl. If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.CrudUrl
member.summary: Specifies the CRUD URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl. If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.BatchUrl
member.summary: Specifies the batch url.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl. If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Json
member.summary: Specifies the IEnumerable collection. This data could be queried and manipulated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Headers

member.remarks: Use Headers to add any custom headers to the request made by DataManager. Users can also send authentication bearer token using Headers property.

member.summary: Enables offline mode in datamanager.

member.summary: The Overline property draws a horizontal line above the text.

member.summary: This property draws a horizontal line under the text in the text block.

member.summary: LineThrough property draws a horizontal line in the center of the text of a node or a connector.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextDecoration.None
member.summary: The None property represents the default text.

member.summary: The TextAlign property allows the user to define the alignment of the text inside the text block.

member.summary: Sets the alignment of text in the text block to the left.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextAlign.Right
member.summary: Sets the alignment of text in the text block to the right.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextAlign.Center
member.summary: Sets the alignment of text in the text block to the center.

member.summary: Sets the alignment of text in respective to left and right margins.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextOverflow
member.summary: The overflow property allows the user to clip the text content or to add scrollbars when the content of the text element is too large to fit in the specified diagram area.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextOverflow.Wrap
member.summary: Wraps the text to the next line, when it exceeds its bounds.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextOverflow.Ellipsis
member.summary: Ellipsis hides the text if the text size exceeds the boundary.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextOverflow.Clip
member.summary: The text is restricted to the node/connector boundary and the text will not be overflown.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextWrap
member.summary: TextWrap property is used to control the overflow of text in the node boundaries. The wrapping property defines how the text should be wrapped.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextWrap.WrapWithOverflow
member.summary: Text-wrapping occurs when the text overflows beyond the available node width. However, the text may overflow beyond the node width in the case of a very long word.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextWrap.Wrap
member.summary: The text will be wrapped inside the boundary.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Wasm.TextWrap.NoWrap
member.summary: The text will not be wrapped. If lengthy text exists, the boundary will not be a limitation.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DropDownList. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DropDownList.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FilterType
member.summary: Determines on which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.

summary.para: When set to `false`, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions.
By default, consider the casing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Query
member.summary: Accepts the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the ChangeOnBlur property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.ClosePopupOnSelect
member.summary: Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.

summary.para: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the MultiSelect component.
It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.DelimiterChar
member.summary: Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.

summary.para: Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.
By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.
This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.
Enable or disable persisting MultiSelect state between page reloads.
If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.EnableSelectionOrder
member.summary: Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the MultiSelect allows the user to interact with it.

summary.para: The `Fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component.

item.description: Maps the text column from data table for each list item.
Maps the value column from data table for each list item.
Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item.
Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
Auto The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the ChangeOnBlur property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.InPlaceEditor.SfInPlaceEditor`1
member.summary: The In-place Editor component is most useful for editing a value dynamically within its context (in-place). It has the built-in support to handle all the form components, including TextBox, Dropdown List, DatePicker, and Rich Text Editor. The component comes with different edit modes and a fully customizable UI.

member.summary:
Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.
Possible values are:
On Specifies that autocomplete is enabled
Off Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel
member.summary: Interface for a class AsyncSettings

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default.
It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed.
This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component.
The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both `Locale` and `Buttons` property,the Uploader component considers the `Buttons` property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the Uploader considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.SequentialUpload
member.summary:
By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the SfMaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the SfMaskedTextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the SfMaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary:
Specifies a value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox component allows the value for the specified range.
True- the input value will be restricted between the min and max range. The typed value gets modified to fit the range on a focused out state.
Else, it allows any value even out of range value, at that time of wrong value entered, the error class will be added to the component to highlight the error.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfNumericTextBox`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Specifies a value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox component allows the value for the specified range.
True - the input value will be restricted between the min and max range. The typed value gets modified to fit the range on a focused out state.
Else, it allows any value even out of range value, at that time of wrong value entered, the error class will be added to the component to highlight the error.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel
member.summary: Interface for a class TextBox

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Autocomplete
member.summary:
Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.
Possible values are:
On Specifies that autocomplete is enabled
Off Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.InputAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the TextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Multiline
member.summary:
Specifies a boolean value that enables or disables the multiline on the TextBox.
The TextBox changes from a single line to multiline when enabling this multiline mode.

member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in TextBox. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.

member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in TextBox.

member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the TextBox such as text, password, email, and more.

member.summary: Specifies the tab order of the TextBox component.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader
member.summary: The uploader component is useful to upload images, documents, and other files to server. The component is the extended version of HTML5 that is uploaded with multiple file selection, auto upload, drag and drop, progress bar, preload files, and validation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ID
member.summary: Specifies the id of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both Locale and Buttons property,the Uploader component considers the Buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.InputAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element. If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AllowMultiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.SequentialUpload
member.summary:
By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.TabIndex
member.summary: Specifies the tab order of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.OnChange
member.summary: Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.BytesToSize(System.Double)
member.summary: It is used to convert bytes value into kilobytes or megabytes depending on the size based on [binary prefix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_prefix).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Cancel(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[])
member.summary: Stops the in-progress chunked upload based on the file data. When the file upload is canceled, the partially uploaded file is removed from server. specifies the files data to cancel the progressing file.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ClearAll
member.summary: Clear all the file entries from list that can be uploaded files or added in upload queue.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.CreateFileList(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create the file list for specified files data. specifies the files data for file list creation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.GetFilesData(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Get the data of files which are shown in file list. specifies the file list item(li) index

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Pause(System.Collections.Generic.List{Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Pauses the in-progress chunked upload based on the file data. specifies the files data to pause from uploading. Set true if used custom UI.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Remove(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object)
member.summary:
Remove the uploaded file from server manually by calling the remove URL action.
If you pass an empty argument to this method, the complete file list can be cleared, otherwise remove the specific file based on its argument ("file_data"). specifies the files data to remove from file list/server. Set true if the component rendering with customize template. Set true if files remove without removing event. Set false, to post file name only to the remove action.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Resume(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Resumes the chunked upload that is previously paused based on the file data. specifies the files data to resume the paused file.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Retry(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retries the canceled or failed file upload based on the file data. specifies the files data to retry the canceled or failed file Set true to retry from canceled stage and set false to retry from initial stage.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.SortFileList(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[])
member.summary: Allows you to sort the file data alphabetically based on its file name clearly. specifies the files data for upload

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Upload(Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.FileInfo[],System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Allows you to call the upload process manually by calling save URL action.
To process the selected files (added in upload queue), pass an empty argument otherwise upload the specific file based on its argument. specifies the files data for upload.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.UpdateChildProperties(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Update the dropdownlist fileds

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings
member.summary: Specifies the Uploader Events of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the ChunkSize to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderButtons
member.summary: Customize the default text of browse, clear, and upload buttons with plain text.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout
member.summary: The DashboardLayout is a grid structured layout component, that helps to create a dashboard with panels. Panels hold the UI components or data to be visualized with flexible options like resize, reorder, drag-n-drop, remove and add, that allows users to easily place the panels at a desired position within the grid layout.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ID
member.summary: Sets id attribute for the dashboard element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowDragging
member.summary: If allowDragging is set to true, then the DashboardLayout allows you to drag and reorder the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowFloating
member.summary: If allowFloating is set to true, then the DashboardLayout automatically move the panels upwards to fill the empty available cells while dragging or resizing the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowResizing
member.summary: If allowResizing is set to true, then the DashboardLayout allows you to resize the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.CellAspectRatio
member.summary: Defines the cell aspect ratio of the panel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.CellSpacing
member.summary: Defines the spacing between the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.Columns
member.summary: Defines the number of columns to be created in the DashboardLayout.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.DraggableHandle
member.summary: Defines the draggable handle selector which will act as dragging handler for the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.MediaQuery
member.summary: Defines the media query value where the dashboardlayout becomes stacked layout when the resolution meets.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Used to specify an additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.Panels
member.summary: Defines the panels property of the DashboardLayout component.

member.summary: Defines the resizing handles directions used for resizing the panels.

member.summary: Enables or disables the grid lines for the Dashboard Layout panels.

member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be appended on the corresponding pane of the Splitter. It is used to customize the Splitter component panes. One or more custom CSS classes can be specified to the Splitter panes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized more than the specified maximum limit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.MaxChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized less than the specified minimum size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.MinChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Resizable
member.summary: Specifies the value whether a pane is resizable or not. By default, the Splitter panes are resizable. You can disable resize functionality for any specific panes using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Size
member.summary: SizeConfigures the properties for each pane. For horizontal splitter, the size act as width. For vertical splitter, the size act as height.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.SizeChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter
member.summary: The splitter is a layout user interface (UI) component that splits the layout into multiple panes with resizable and collapsible support.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.ID
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets the content for panes of the Splitter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be appended on the root element of the Splitter. It is used to customize the Splitter component. One or more custom CSS classes can be specified to the Splitter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the component is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables the persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, the pane settings of Splitter is persisted

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Splitter component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Orientation
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether to align the split panes horizontally or vertically. Set the orientation property as "Horizontal" to create a horizontal splitter that aligns the panes left-to-right. Set the orientation property as "Vertical" to create a vertical splitter that aligns the panes top-to-bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.PaneSettings
member.summary: Configures the individual pane behaviors such as content, size, resizable, minimum, maximum validation, collapsible, and collapsed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.SeparatorSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the separator line for both horizontal and vertical orientation. The separator is used to separate the panes by lines.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Splitter component. The value can be either in pixel or percentage format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the splitter element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized less than the specified minimum size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Resizable
member.summary: Specifies the value whether a pane is resizable or not. By default, the Splitter panes are resizable. You can disable resize functionality for any specific panes using this property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1
member.summary: The SfListView control represents the data in interactive hierarchical structure interface across different layouts or views, that also has features such as data-binding, template, grouping and virtualization.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.ID
member.summary: The `ID` property is used as a key to identify our element

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Animation
member.summary: The `Animation` property provides an option to apply the different animations on the ListView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.CheckBoxPosition
member.summary: The `CheckBoxPosition` is used to set the position of check box in a list item. By default, the `checkBoxPosition` is Left, which will appear before the text content in a list item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.CssClass
member.summary: The `CssClass` property is used to add a user-preferred class name in the root element of the ListView, using which we can customize the component (both CSS and functionality customization)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.DataSource
member.summary: The `DataSource` provides the data to render the ListView component which is mapped with the fields of ListView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Enabled
member.summary: If `Enabled` set to true, the list items are enabled. And, we can disable the component using this property by setting its value as false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: If `EnableVirtualization` set to true, which will increase the ListView performance, while loading a large amount of data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Fields
member.summary: The `Fields` is used to map keys from the dataSource which extracts the appropriate data from the dataSource with specified mapped with the column fields to render the ListView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.HeaderTitle
member.summary: The `HeaderTitle` is used to set the title of the ListView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Height
member.summary: Defines the height of the ListView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: The `HtmlAttributes` allows additional attributes such as id, class, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.Query
member.summary: The `Query` is used to fetch the specific data from dataSource by using where and select keywords.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: If `ShowCheckBox` set to true, which will show or hide the checkbox.

member.summary: Adds new item to the Accordion with the specified index of the Accordion.

member.summary: Dynamically removes item from Accordion.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.EnableItem(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or Disables the specified Accordion item.
member.param: Number value that determines which item should be enabled/disabled.
Boolean value that determines the action as enable (true) or disable (false). If the `isEnable` value is true, the item is enabled or else it is disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.ExpandItem(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Expands/Collapses the specified Accordion item.
member.param: Boolean value that determines the action as expand or collapse.

Number value that determines which item should be expanded/collapsed.`index` is optional parameter. Without Specifying index, based on the `isExpand` value all Accordion item can be expanded or collapsed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.HideItem(System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the specified item from Accordion.
member.param: Number value that determines which item should be hidden/shown.
Boolean value that determines the action either hide (true) or show (false). Default value is false. If the `isHidden` value is false, the item is shown or else item it is hidden.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.Select(System.Double)

member.summary: Specifies the media query string for resolution, when opens the Sidebar. Example: assigning media query value to '(min-width: 600px)' will open the sidebar component only when the provided resolution is met else the sidebar will be in closed state.

member.summary: Specifies the position of the Sidebar.

member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of the main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content. Width can also be set in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as the overlay type.

member.summary: You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.HeaderModel.IconPosition
member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on the `IconCss` property. The possible values are: - left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.summary: Tab is a content panel to show multiple contents in a compact space. Also, only one tab is active at a time. Each Tab item has an associated content, that will be displayed based on the active Tab.

member.summary: Sets ID attribute for the tab element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.ChildContent
member.summary: Child Content for Tab.

member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the Tabs component. The animation effect can be applied to activate the tab with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to the root element of the Tabs that helps to customize the component styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, the tabs selected item will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the Tab allows drag and drop over tab items. Tab item has been reordered based on the dropped item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.DragArea
member.summary: Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs with Tabitems.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header at the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tabs component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Items
member.summary: A list of items that are used to configure the Tabs component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.LoadOn
member.summary: Specifies the modes for the Tab content. The possible modes are: `Dynamic` Load the Tab content dynamically, which is rendering its content when switching its header. `Init` Loads all the tab contents on initial loading. `Demand` Loads the Tab content when required but keeps the content once it is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode which will be applied when the Tabs exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements will be displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container will hold the items that can be placed within the available space and the rest of the items will be moved to the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance that applies when scrolling in Tab and enabled Scrollable mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.SelectedItem
member.summary: Specifies the index for activating the Tab item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Tabs component. By default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.

member.summary: Event triggers when `click` the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the template that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: Child Content for Toolbar
